product_title: SleepO2 Wrist Recording Pulse Oximeter by EMAY | Continuous Pulse Oximeter to Record Blood Oxygen Saturation and Pulse Rate Overnight | Export Sleep Report & Raw Data
about_product: Most lightweighted wrist pulse oximeter in the market, it weighs only 100 gram that one can sleep with comfortably. Patented silicone soft probe to wear comfortably, never slip off your finger.
Record your blood oxygen saturation (SpO2) & heart rate every second continuously and accurately throughout the night.
Stand-alone wrist pulse oximeter with built-in recording feature. Just wear it to record overnight, and take it off to sync with app in the morning.
Intelligent app allows you to review data second by second, and generate a professional sleep report with valuable data including ODI4% and trend graphs.
Rechargeable lithium battery, 12 hours' battery life. The device is for sports/wellness reference use only, not for medical or diagnostic purpose.

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: #22,172 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household)  #18 in Athletic & Aviation Pulse Oximeters

customers_say: Customers find the pulse oximeter easy to use and set up, with a user-friendly app and straightforward data upload process. The device provides accurate readings and generates detailed reports, making it a fantastic tool for monitoring oxygen levels during sleep. Customers appreciate its comfort and consider it well worth the price.

top_reviews.review_comment: I cannot believe how easy it could be to monitor and track my blood oxygen levels. I am able to update my doctor with levels that are recorded overnight while I am asleep. The data is saved and downloaded making it very easy to track trends. I also was able to leave a remark about factors that could be contributing to sp02 specifics. Very easy to use. The instructions are very specific. The smartphone app is also easy to use and includes an online manual that you can view anytime. The reports are easy to understand and allows you to be in charge of your own health. Great price too! Highly recommend/
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Very easy to use, covenient reporting
top_reviews.review_comment: Device does exactly as described. It measures and saves oximetry during a sleep period (nap or all night) and, on request, sends it to a simple reporting APP. Its bluetooth connection (APP) never fails once configured. Data transfer for a nights sleep takes only a few seconds. Used less than a month but has always been trustworthy and accurate. APP used on iPhone 18.6
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: I have been using this Pulse Oximeter Recorder for a week to monitor my sleep apnea. It is easy to use and generates very detailed reports after every night which you can download as a PDF or an image file. You can also download the raw data to import into Excel if you like to do your own analysis. The 48 hour data limit is not a problem if you download the data every day, since it clears the device memory once you download the data. I charge mine every morning when I get up after I download the data, so the device is ready to go the next night. Battery life is not an issue since I charge it daily. The finger cuff is comfortable to wear, although the little velcro strap to hold the device/wire against your finger is marginal. I use a small strip of self adhesive medical tape to secure it better. Before I started using the tape, I did have the device come off my finger while I was sleeping a few times, but the device started recording again once I woke up and put the cuff back on my finger. The data collection just shows a blank during that time. The device syncs its time to your phone via the app. The app (Android for me) is easy to navigate and works well to access reports and status. This is the only recording pulse oximeter I have used, so I cannot compare to other brands or devices. But this one meets my needs beautifully.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Great value and works as expected
top_reviews.review_comment: I have used the SleepO2 Wrist Pulse Oximeter now for a few weeks and it is working great. It has been very helpful to see what my oxygen levels are doing through the night. I have not had any problems with the finger sensor staying on, as others have noticed. The battery does only last one night, and this is definitely an area for improvement. I would definitely recommend this pulse oximeter for the price and ease of use.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: I don't write many reviews, but I purchased Emay's fingertip monitor a few weeks ago and really liked it. It was well-built for the price, and the app was easy to use and provided allot of good information. I realized, however, that I needed something I could wear for long periods. I use a cpap, have afib, and wanted to monitor my oxygen throughout the night. I have a Fitbit watch, but it just gives me an average and not the data. Which led me to this. This wrist SpO2 monitor was designed to be worn for extended periods... I'm guessing it would also work great if you wanted to monitor your pulse and SpO2 during exercise. I was quite honestly surprised at how comfortable it was, how well it was made, and how easy it was to use. The fingertip sensor is in a rubber sleeve that goes over your finger, and it holds it snug but doesn't squeeze like other models. When I look at a breakdown in the data for the night, there are no gaps where the sensor has slipped off or moved. The wrist portion houses the battery and all of the electronics, to keep the sensor light on your finger. Note that there is no instant display of the data, until you transfer it to your phone, which is I'm guessing the reason for the long battery life. I was a able to get 3 solid nights on a charge, roughly 24 hours. I have purchased a handful of SpO2 monitors, and this is by far now my favorite. It is also the most accurate, and based on the report from this monitor my doctor is now considering supplemental oxygen. If you want to spot check your pulse rate or SpO2 you should still get a fingertip monitor for an instant reading, but your result will never be as good as wearing it all night. I have looked through all the pr SpO2 monitors on Amazon, and haven't found one better than this for the price. I highly recommend it.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2022

top_reviews.review_comment: The EMAY Oximeter is an awesome product! In addition to the thorough detail that the EMAY Summary report has, I discovered that it also imports minute-to-minute oxygen level data from your overnight reading into the Apple MyHealth app which is useful to view on your overall health summary dashboard and one that I missed seeing when I upgraded my Apple Watch where the Blood Oxygen feature wasn’t included in the newer Apple watch series. I took the EMAY Summary Reports to two different healthcare providers who were both equally impressed with the level of detail and accuracy that the reports show. Both commented that they were going to recommend this product to their patients and how useful it will be in their treatment plan. In addition to a solid product, the customer service is outstanding. I received an email from the service team checking to make sure my device was working well for me and asking if I had any follow up questions or suggestions. I am very impressed and highly recommend this product and company.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Easy to use - Nice Reports - Works well
top_reviews.review_comment: Works perfect! Mild Sleep Apnea and was able to measure with and without my Sleep Apnea mouthpiece and with and without a back pillow! Easy to use the app, reports are nicely formatted easy to print for review with my doc. At this point used for a month.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_comment: Bought for my wife to monitor oxygen levels during sleep. She has been diagnosed with sleep apnea and the cpap doesn't monitor oxygen levels. The app is great and gives lots of information and printable reports. It does come with a tiny velcro finger strap to keep the finger monitor in place but 5mm micropore works better. Had a query about something on the app and emailed customer services and got a reply back quickly. I was a bit apprehensive as its cheaper than lot of the overnight monitors but really pleased and reading's appear to be accurate as have compared with a medical one.
top_reviews_global.review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 12, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_comment: This sleep 02 wrist oxygen monitor is an excellent way to track oxygen levels and pulse rate during sleep and not expensive. The app is super easy to install and provides data which is simple to understand. Being able to assess sleep health has proved very beneficial. I bought it to assess my breathing as hadn’t worn my CPAP mask for 2 weeks and wondered what effect this had on my oxygen levels. Well I soon found out that things weren’t great - large oxygen dips and varying pulse levels. Each night I’d try something different (pillows/breathe easy strips/no alcohol) in the hope that if I could reduce my sleep apnea incidents I’d not need my CPAP mask anymore. Wishful thinking! BUT this amazing 02 wrist monitor has allowed me to to understand just how much I need my mask and not dislike it so much! Worth every penny, best purchase I’ve made in a long time.
top_reviews_global.review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 23, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_comment: delivery was fast. product as description. its packed in a cubic plastic box. handy to use&store. battery charge is fast. roughly can use for 2nights for 1 charge. connection with phone is good by Bluetooth. data can store in the watch & disconnect the phone while using. save phone battery & no blue light during sleeping. report can be shown to doctor as reference. the finger cap is spacious. good for thick fingers. but mine is narrow. i find its loose& would fall off. i needa fix a bit by something add on. its also written in users instructions. the battery indicator shows only when its in live mode & connect to phone. the band doesn't contain screen. overall, its effective gadget if u wanna have reference of ur oxygen levels & heart rate.
top_reviews_global.review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 24, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_title: Brilliant little device for tracking apnea.
top_reviews_global.review_comment: Cracking big of kit , having been recently diagnosed with very mild apnea this little beauty has helped me to track the effectiveness of sleep position changes, mouth tape and supplements on my apnea. An absolute game changer with an easy to understand report function and data graphs
top_reviews_global.review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 29, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_comment: Awesome product. After sales team have been amazing. Thank you.
top_reviews_global.review_date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 26, 2025
